{{Other people|Michael Klein}} {{Infobox person |name = Michael Klein |image = |image_size = |alt = |caption = |birth_name = |birth_date = {{birth year and age|1951}} |birth_place = [[Munich]], [[Germany]] |residence = [[Barueri]], [[Brazil]] |citizenship = [[Brazilian people|Brazilian]] |education = |alma_mater = Paes de Barros University
[[Getulio Vargas Foundation]] |occupation = [[CEO]] of [[Casas Bahia]]
[[Board of directors|Director]] of [[Via Varejo]]
[[Chairman]] of Grupo CB |years_active = 1969-present |net_worth = {{increase}} [[USD|US$]]1.5 billion (2017) |boards = |spouse = |children = 4 |parents = |known_for = Former Chairman of Via Varejo |signature = |signature_alt= |website = [http://www.grupocb.com.br/ www.grupocb.com.br] }} '''Michael Klein''' (born 1951) is a [[Brazilian people|Brazilian]] [[business executive]]. He is the [[CEO]] of the Brazilian chain of department stores, [[Casas Bahia]], and a Member of the [[Board of Directors]] of [[Via Varejo]], the parent company of Casas Bahia, [[Cnova]] and Ponto Frio.[http://ri.viavarejo.com.br/conteudo_en.asp?idioma=1&conta=44&tipo=53075 "Directors, Executive Officers and Committees"], ''Viavarejo''. Retrieved on 22 July 2015. Michael's father, [[Samuel Klein (businessman)|Samuel Klein]], founded Casas Bahia in 1952. In 2017, in its real-time ranking of the wealthiest people in Brazil, ''[[Forbes]]'' ranked him the 31st with a personal net worth of $1.5 billion.[https://www.forbes.com/billionaires/list/#version:realtime_country:Brazil "The World's Billionaires List"]. ''Forbes''. Retrieved 27 January 2017. Klein and his family reside in [[Alphaville, São Paulo|Alphaville]], a gated community situated in [[Greater São Paulo|São Paulo]].[http://www.thecolombianpost.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=575:575&catid=40:general-info&Itemid=153 "Brazil's Elites Fly Above Their Fears"]. ''The Colombian Post''. 3 June 2002. Retrieved 23 June 2013. ==Career ventures== ===Casas Bahia and Via Varejo=== Klein graduated with a degree in Business Administration from Paes de Barros University, and completed his post-graduate studies at the [[Getulio Vargas Foundation]]. In 1969, he joined Casas Bahia as a Financial Manager.[http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=24900299&privcapId=7614226&previousCapId=880492&previousTitle=GLOBEX%20UTILIDADES%20SA "Michael Klein"], ''Businessweek''. Retrieved on 9 September 2013. In 2009, Klein became CEO of the company after his father retired in Brazil. In 2010, he was elected Chairman of the Board of Directors of Via Varejo. His son, Raphael Oscar Klein, has served as a Member of the Board of Directors of Via Varejo. In May 2013, it was announced that the Klein family, which owned 47% of Via Varejo, was planning to sell 16% of their stake in the company.Jelmayer, Rogerio (14 June 2013). [https://online.wsj.com/article/BT-CO-20130614-704818.html?mod=googlenews_wsj "Brazil Durable Goods Retailer Via Varejo Plans Share Offers"]. ''The Wall Street Journal''. Retrieved 23 June 2013. In September 2013, Klein transferred 17.6 million of his shares of Via Varejo to his children,Marinelli, Luciana (9 September 2013). [http://www.valor.com.br/empresas/3264390/familia-klein-confirma-reorganizacao-societaria-na-varejo "Família Klein confirma reorganização societária na Via Varejo"] (in Portuguese). ''Valor''. Retrieved 9 September 2013. and as a result, his stake in the company has been reduced from 21.9% to 18%.Ayres, Marcela (10 September 2013). [http://br.reuters.com/article/businessNews/idBRSPE98906720130910 "Família Klein reorganiza participação societária na Via Varejo"] (in Portuguese). ''Reuters Brasil''. Retrieved 11 September 2013. 53.7 million common shares of the family's stake began trading on December 16, 2013.[https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/11/25/brazil-viavarejo-offer-idUSL2N0JA0H320131125 "Brazil's Pao de Acucar, Klein family to sell Via Varejo shares"]. ''Reuters''. 25 November 2013. Retrieved 26 November 2013. Via Varejo raised [[R$]] 2.845 billion through a [[public offering]] of shares. Three quarters of the amount raised went to the Klein family, while the rest went to GPA.[http://jcrs.uol.com.br/site/noticia.php?codn=142629 "Ações da Via Varejo estreiam em alta na Bovespa"] (in Portuguese). ''[[Universo Online|UOL]]'' (São Paulo). 16 December 2013. Retrieved 17 December 2013. Ownership of the company has changed to GPA with 43.3%, the Klein family with 27.3%, and minority shareholders with 29.3%.[http://ri.viavarejo.com.br/conteudo_en.asp?idioma=1&conta=44&tipo=53072 "Corporate Governance"]. ''Via Varejo''. Retrieved 16 August 2016. In June 2014, Cnova, a global e-commerce company with a total gross merchandise volume of $4.9 billion, was created through a [[joint venture]] between [[Groupe Casino|Casino]], GPA, Via Varejo and [[Grupo Éxito|Exito]]. Cnova will be directly owned 46.5% by Casino (including its subsidiary Exito) and 53.5% indirectly by GPA, Via Varejo and certain founding shareholders of Nova Pontocom.[https://www.reuters.com/finance/stocks/VVAR3.SA/key-developments/article/3004856 "Casino Guichard Perrachon sets up with Via Varejo global ecommerce joint venture Cnova"]. ''[[Reuters]]''. 4 June 2014. Retrieved 22 June 2014.[http://inpublic.globenewswire.com/2014/06/04/Casino+Group+Creation+of+a+major+global+ecommerce+Cnova+HUG1790807.html "Casino Group: Creation of a major global ecommerce - Cnova"]. ''[[GlobeNewswire]]''. 4 June 2014. Retrieved 22 June 2014. The Klein family hold a 5.98% stake in Cnova, which owns and operates the following online stores: Extra.com.br, Casasbahia.com.br, Pontofrio.com, Cdiscount.com.br, Barateiro.com, Pontofrio Atacado, and eHub.com.br.[http://www.cnova.com/en/our-websites/latin-america/ "Our Websites"]. ''[[Cnova]]''. Retrieved 16 August 2016. In August 2014, it was announced that Klein may sell an amount of shares valued at R$3 billion of his stake in Via Varejo.Poli, Marcelo (8 August 2014). [http://exame.abril.com.br/mercados/noticias/michael-klein-pode-vender-bilhoes-em-acoes-da-via-varejo "Michael Klein pode vender bilhões em ações da Via Varejo"] (in Portuguese). ''Exame (São Paulo)''. Retrieved 9 August 2014. In May 2016, it was announced that Klein is interested in buying back control of Via Varejo.Jardim, Lauro (1 May 2016). [http://blogs.oglobo.globo.com/lauro-jardim/post/klein-quer-recomprar-o-controle-da-varejo.html "Klein quer recomprar o controle da Via Varejo" (in Portuguese]. ''[[O Globo]]''. Retrieved 1 May 2016. In October 2016, it was revealed that the [[Steinhoff International|Steinhoff Group]] is in talks to buy the Klein family's stake in Via Varejo, in a deal that could reach R$1.5 billion.[https://www.noticiasaominuto.com.br/economia/293706/grupo-alemao-negocia-participacao-de-casas-bahia-e-ponto-frio "Grupo alemão negocia participação de Casas Bahia e Ponto Frio"]. ''Notícias Ao Minuto''. 18 October 2016. Retrieved 18 October 2016. In March 2017, it was reported that Klein is lining up a proposal with several investment funds to buy back control of Via Varejo. Under Klein's plan, he would become the majority shareholder of Via Varejo, with just over 50% of the shares, and would have autonomy in management.Granato, Luísa & Calegari, Luiza (20 March 2017). [http://exame.abril.com.br/mercados/tudo-o-que-voce-precisa-saber-antes-de-o-mercado-abrir-97/ "Tudo o que você precisa saber antes de o mercado abrir" (in Portuguese)]. ''Exame.com''. Retrieved 20 March 2017. As of January 2018, the Klein family hold a 25.35% stake in Via Varejo, which consists of the following individual stakes:[http://bvmf.bmfbovespa.com.br/cias-listadas/empresas-listadas/ResumoEmpresaPrincipal.aspx?codigoCvm=6505 "VIA VAREJO S.A."]. ''[[BM&FBOVESPA]]''. 8 January 2018. Retrieved 8 January 2017. * Eva Klein (Michael Klein's sister) - 6.34% * Goldentree Fundo de Investimento em Ações (owned by the Klein family) - 9.71% * Twinsk Fundo de Investimento Multimercado Crédito Privado (owned by the Klein family) - 9.30% ===Grupo CB=== In May 2014, BR Properties, a Brazilian real estate investment firm, confirmed it was negotiating a sale of its assets with Klein.[http://www.istoedinheiro.com.br/noticias/negocios/20140521/properties-confirma-conversas-com-michael-klein/156431.shtml "BR Properties confirma conversas com Michael Klein"] (in Portuguese). ''[[ISTOÉ|ISTOÉ Dinheiro]]''. 21 May 2014. Retrieved 26 May 2014. In July 2014, Grupo CB, the Klein family's [[holding company]] chaired by Michael Klein, purchased a real estate fund from BR Properties for R$606.65 million. The fund includes 26 [[C&A]] stores, a Brooksfield store, a [[Sendas (supermarket)|Sendas]] store, a call centre, and offices on [[Paulista Avenue]] in downtown São Paulo, totaling 118,000 square meters of commercial space.Friedlander, David (3 July 2014). [http://www.tnonline.com.br/noticias/economia/34,275553,03,07,familia-klein-ex-casas-bahia-compra-fundo-com-36-imoveis-por-r-606-mi.shtml "Família Klein, ex-Casas Bahia, compra fundo com 36 imóveis por R$ 606 mi"] (in Portuguese). ''TNOnline''. Retrieved 3 July 2014.Pavani, Luana (3 July 2014). [http://economia.estadao.com.br/noticias/mercados,grupo-cb-compra-cotas-de-fundo-da-br-properties,1522818 "Grupo CB compra cotas de fundo da BR Properties".] (in Portuguese). ''[[O Estado de S. Paulo|Estadao]]''. Retrieved 3 July 2014. In March 2015, Grupo CB acquired five office properties occupied by Wells Fargo, totaling 1.6 million square feet across four Southern U.S. states.Zanki, Tom (9 March 2015). [http://www.law360.com/articles/629195/brazilian-trust-wins-95m-financing-for-wells-fargo-offices "Brazilian Trust Wins $95M Financing For Wells Fargo Offices"]. ''Law360''. Retrieved 11 March 2015. In March 2016, Grupo CB opened a [[Mercedes-Benz]] dealership in [[Jundiai|Jundiai, São Paulo]].Vaz, Tatiana (10 March 2016). [http://exame.abril.com.br/negocios/noticias/michael-klein-abre-concessionaria-da-mercedes-em-jundiai "Michael Klein abre concessionária da Mercedes em Jundiaí"]. ''EXAME.com''. Retrieved 18 April 2016. Today, Grupo CB holds a R$6 billion portfolio. The portfolio includes 432 real estate properties, including stores, industrial warehouses, administrative complexes, offices and distribution centers, totaling over 2 million square meters of commercial space. Grupo CB's rental revenue is expected to be R$430 million in 2017.Oscar, Naiana (25 April 2016). [http://www.gazetadopovo.com.br/economia/herdeiro-da-casas-bahia-desiste-da-classe-c-e-lanca-negocios-para-a-alta-renda-3o81mgqg4wka17llyp9gprlxn "Herdeiro da Casas Bahia desiste da classe C e lança negócios para a alta renda" (in Portuguese)]. ''Gazeta Do Povo''. Retrieved 26 April 2016.[http://www.grupocb.com.br/negocios-imobiliarios/ "Negócios Imobiliários"] (in Portuguese). ''Grupo CB''. Retrieved 26 April 2016.[https://www.ajot.com/news/warren-buffett-wannabe-bets-on-jets-in-down-and-out-brazil-2 "Warren Buffett Wannabe Bets on Jets in Down-and-Out Brazil"]. ''American Journal of Transportation''. 5 October 2017. Retrieved 7 October 2017. ====CB Air==== CB Air, an air taxi company founded by Klein in 2012, has received operational authorization from [[National Civil Aviation Agency of Brazil|ANAC]] in January 2015. The company's fleet includes 15 business jets and helicopters, and 2 hangars in [[Campo de Marte Airport]] and [[Sorocaba Airport]].Vaz, Tatiana (20 January 2015). [http://exame.abril.com.br/negocios/noticias/empresa-de-aviacao-de-michael-klein-ja-pode-voar "Empresa de aviação de Michael Klein já pode voar"] (in Portuguese). ''Exame (São Paulo)''. Retrieved 20 January 2015.[http://www.cbair.com.br/aeronaves/?lang=en "Aeronaves - CBAir"] (in Portuguese). ''CBAir''. Retrieved 26 April 2016. In September 2013, it was announced that Klein was in talks to purchase AVX Táxi Aéreo, an air taxi company owned by [[Eike Batista]].[http://www.valor.com.br/international/news/3271854/retail-mogul-talks-buy-eike-batistas-air-taxi-company "Retail mogul in talks to buy Eike Batista's air taxi company"]. ''Valor International''. 17 September 2013. Retrieved 29 April 2016. In April 2016, it was revealed that [[Neymar]] purchased a business jet from the Klein family for $9.1 million.Ramírez , Pau (29 April 2016). ([http://www.mundodeportivo.com/futbol/fc-barcelona/20160429/401446342317/neymar-se-compro-un-avion-en-brasil-por-8-millones-de-euros.html "Neymar se compró un avión en Brasil por 8 millones de euros" (in Portuguese]. ''[[Mundo Deportivo]]''. Retrieved 29 April 2016. In August 2016, it was announced that Klein has made an offer for the purchase of Global Aviation, an air taxi company.Caetano, Rodrigo (17 August 2016). [http://www.istoedinheiro.com.br/noticias/negocios/20160817/klein-negocia-compra-empresa-taxi-aereo/404588 "Michael Klein faz oferta pela empresa de táxi aéreo Global Aviation" (in Portuguese)]. ''Istoe Dinheiro''. Retrieved 18 August 2016. Created in 1994, Global Aviation resulted from the merger of Reali Táxi Aéreo, Pássaro Azul and Global Táxi Aéreo. It operates a 25-aircraft fleet of planes and helicopters, as well as bases in Brazil’s top airports. It recently inaugurated a hangar in Sorocaba, São Paulo, with capacity for 17 aircraft where it offers runway services, aircraft management, medevac, shared ownership and aircraft sales, in addition to domestic and international private flights.[http://www.valor.com.br/international/news/4677455/cbair-talks-buy-bigger-rival-global-aviation "CBAir in talks to buy bigger rival Global Aviation"]. ''Valor Econômico S. A.''. 19 August 2016. Retrieved 19 August 2016. On August 22, it was announced that Klein has purchased Global Aviation for R$70 million. The deal means CB Air will increase its fleet to 32 aircraft from 12, and will have combined revenues of R$200 million in 2017.Bigarelli, Barbara (22 August 2016). [http://epocanegocios.globo.com/Empresa/noticia/2016/08/michael-klein-compra-empresa-de-aviacao-executiva-por-r-38-milhoes.html "Michael Klein compra empresa de aviação executiva por R$ 38 milhões" (in Portuguese)]. ''Globo.com''. Retrieved 23 August 2016.[https://www.reuters.com/article/global-aviation-ma-cb-air-idUSL1N1B316M "Brazil's CB Air to acquire rival air taxi firm Global Aviation"]. ''Reuters''. 22 August 2016. Retrieved 23 August 2016. In December 2016, it was announced that the National Civil Aviation Agency (ANAC) and the Administrative Council for Economic Defense (CADE) granted CB Air the green light for the acquisition of Global Aviation without restriction. The name of the new operator will be announced in the first quarter of next year and the new air taxi company will have a fleet of 34 aircraft including airplanes, helicopters and ten hangars and two heliports.Oliveira, Junio (8 December 2016). [http://jornaldoar.com/2016/12/anac-cade-autoriza-compra-da-global-aviation-pela-cb-air/ "ANAC e CADE autoriza aquisição da Global Aviation pela CB Air"] (in Portuguese). ''Jornal Do Ar''. Retrieved 14 December 2016. After the merger of CB Air with Global Aviation, the company is now branded Icon Aviation. With a revenue forecast of R$160 million in 2017, Icon Aviation offers several services in the area of business aircraft, such as aircraft and helicopter charters, management, sale and purchase of aircraft, shared ownership, hangar and track services. The company has a fleet of 30 aircraft, including 22 airplanes and eight helicopters, as well as 10 hangars and 285 employees. The new brand will bring together all aviation companies that are now part of the group: CB Air Táxi Aéreo Ltda., Global Táxi Aéreo Ltda., Pássaro Azul Táxi Aéreo Ltda., SSR Assessoria e Prestação de Serviços Ltda., and Security Táxi Aéreo Ltda.[http://aeromagazine.uol.com.br/artigo/empresa-de-taxi-aereo-de-michael-klein-ganha-novo-nome_3551.html "Empresa de táxi-aéreo de Michael Klein estreia novo nome" (in Portuguese)]. ''Aero Magazine''. 23 May 2017. Retrieved 29 May 2017. ==References== {{Reflist|2}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Klein, Michael}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Brazilian Jews]] [[Category:Brazilian people of Polish-Jewish descent]] [[Category:Brazilian businesspeople]] [[Category:Businesspeople in retailing]] [[Category:Businesspeople from São Paulo]] [[Category:Brazilian chief executives]] [[Category:1951 births]]

(m. 1966–present) |children = 1 son, 1 daughter |profession = Politician / businessman }} {{Politics of the Isle of Man}} '''Sir Miles Rawstron Walker''' {{post-nominals|country=GBR|CBE}} (born 13 November 1940{{cite web| title=Walker, Miles Rawstron| url=http://www.tynwald.org.im/tynwald/biographies/walker-mr.pdf| work=| publisher=www.tynwald.org| date=| accessdate=11 November 2011| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120414184409/http://www.tynwald.org.im/tynwald/biographies/walker-mr.pdf| archivedate=14 April 2012| df=dmy-all}}) is a [[Isle of Man|Manx]] businessman and politician, who was the first ever [[Chief Minister of the Isle of Man]].{{cite book|last=Belchem|first=John|title=A New History of the Isle of Man: The modern period 1830–1999|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=yjHHVG_aiOAC&pg=PA197|accessdate=20 May 2011|year=2000|publisher=Liverpool University Press|isbn=978-0-85323-726-6|pages=197–}}{{cite book|last=Kermode|first=D. G.|title=Offshore island politics: the constitutional and political development of the Isle of Man in the twentieth century|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=2POOu_fzH5IC&pg=PA318|accessdate=20 May 2011|year=2001|publisher=Liverpool University Press|isbn=978-0-85323-777-8|page=283}} ==Early life and career== Born on 13 November 1940 to George Denis Walker and Alice (née Whittaker), he was educated at [[Castle Rushen High School]] and the Shropshire Agricultural College. He later went on to become a [[chief executive officer|company director]] in the farming and retail dairy trade. He was an [[Arbory (parish)|Arbory]] commissioner (a local government role) from 1970 until 1976, latterly as the chairman. In 1976 he was elected as [[House of Keys|MHK]] for [[Rushen (constituency)|Rushen]] and was successful. He remained an MHK until he retired at the 2001 General Election. In 1986 he was elected as the island's first ever Chief Minister, and continued in the post until the 1996 election. He was honoured as [[Commander of the Order of the British Empire]] (CBE) in 1991. He was awarded an honorary doctorate ([[Doctor of Laws|LL.D.]]) in 1994 by [[Liverpool University]], and was [[Knight Bachelor|knighted]] in 1997. ==Personal life== Walker has been married to Mary since 1966; they have one son and one daughter together and live in [[Colby, Isle of Man|Colby]], Isle of Man.{{Citation needed|date=November 2011}} Sir Miles has two grandchildren, Harry and Joe Walker. Miles is very proud of the pair as Harry plays for [[Colby A.F.C.]] and is a regular goalscorer for the Combination side. Also Joe who is a keen golfer at Port St Mary golf course. ==Government positions== *Chairman of Tromode House Committee, 1977–80 *Chairman of the Broadcasting Commission, 1979–81 *Chairman of the {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2018}} {{Infobox person | image = <!-- Only freely-licensed images may be used to depict living people. See [[WP:NONFREE]]. --> | image_size = 150px | | name = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1988|1|7}} | birth_place = | residence = [[Brno]], [[Czech Republic]] | nationality = Czech | education = [[Newton College (Brno)|Newton College]], [[Brno]] | occupation = CEO of [[Kiwi.com]] | title = | networth = | spouse = | partner = | children = }} '''Oliver Dlouhý''' (7 January 1988) is the founder and CEO of a unique airline tickets search engine [[Kiwi.com]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.crunchbase.com/person/oliver-dlouh|title=Oliver Dlouhý - co-founder and CEO @ Kiwi.com|website=Crunchbase.com|accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> In 2012 the company started using the name Skypicker, grown very rapidly and in May 2016 it was rebranded to [[Kiwi.com]].<ref>https://www.noah-conference.com/attendee/oliver-dlouhy/</ref> The [[Forbes]] business magazine included Oliver to ''Forbes Czech'' "30 under 30".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/lan-anh-vu/ceo-talk-oliver-dlouhy-co_b_9276752.html|title=CEO Talk: Oliver Dlouhy, Co-founder and CEO, Skypicker|first=Lan Anh|last=Vu|date=22 February 2016|publisher=[[Huff Post]]|accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> On 30 May 2016 [[NBC News]] invited Oliver to explain how the unique searching algorithm works.<ref>https://www.cnbc.com/video/2016/05/30/how-kiwi-com-differs-from-the-likes-of-expedia.html</ref> In August 2017 the company provided access to over 700 airlines and served over 50 million searches daily.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bmmagazine.co.uk/entrepreneur-interviews/profiles/getting-know-oliver-dlouhy-founder-ceo-kiwi-com/|title=Getting to know you: Oliver Dlouhy, Founder & CEO, Kiwi.com|date=1 August 2017|website=Bmmagazine.co.uk|accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> For the 7165% growth the company was ranked 7th in [[Deloitte Fast 500|Deloitte Technology Fast 500 Awards]], category Fast 500 [[EMEA]] in 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://feedit.cz/2017/12/08/kiwi-com-je-nejlepe-umistenou-ceskou-firmou-v-desitce-nejrychleji-rostoucich-technologickych-spolecnosti-evropy-blizkeho-vychodu-a-afriky|title=Kiwi.com je nejlépe umístěnou českou firmou v desítce nejrychleji rostoucích technologických společností Evropy, Blízkého východu a Afriky|date=8 December 2017|website=Feedit.cz|accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>
In May 2017 Oliver said he expects to double the company's sales to 700 million euros and in 2018 to grow faster due to expansion of database connections and adding the ground transport.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-cee-summit-kiwi-com/kiwi-com-in-talks-to-raise-funds-for-next-leg-of-travel-idUSKBN18J2DF|title=Kiwi.com in talks to raise funds for next leg of travel|date=23 May 2017|website=Reuters.com|accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref>

[[File:Camara municipal Povoa Varzim bandeiras.JPG|230px|right|thumb|City Hall, in Almada Square, dressed with Póvoa de Varzim municipal flags.]] '''Póvoa de Varzim City Center''' or '''Downtown Póvoa de Varzim''' (Portuguese, ''Centro'') is the heart of [[Póvoa de Varzim]] in [[Portugal]], and is the location for most of the city's municipal services, tourist attractions and businesses. It is the center, not only for the city or the municipality, but also neighboring municipalities. The greater downtown area also called "Centro" can also include most districts part of [[Póvoa de Varzim Parish]].
Downtown, as defined by the City Hall, is arranged around [[Praça do Almada]], the civic center, and extends in all directions for a number of blocks, including [[Rua da Junqueira|Junqueira shopping street]], [[Passeio Alegre]] waterfront square, Mouzinho de Albuquerque business avenue, and Praça Marquês de Pombal (market square). It does not include the medieval and Discovery Age civic center of the city which is located in [[Bairro da Matriz]] district.
Despite proven to be occupied at least since the Roman period, Downtown developed its current layout in the 18th century, by royal order of Queen Mary I of Portugal due to the importance that Póvoa de Varzim got as the main seaport in Northern Portugal.
==Urban morphology== [[File:Pvz-Centro.PNG|175px|left|thumb|Póvoa de Varzim City Center within Póvoa de Varzim urban area.]] [[File:Rua da Junqueira Povoa Varzim.jpg|thumb|The [[Rua da Junqueira]] shopping street.]] [[File:Largo David Alves Povoa Varzim.jpg|thumb|[[Largo David Alves]].]] [[File:Casino povoa e hotel.jpg|thumb|[[Passeio Alegre]] beachfront.]] [[File:Credito Agricola Povoa Varzim.JPG|thumb|Bank headquarters in [[Largo das Dores|Dores Square]].]] [[File:Pelourinhopovoavarzim.jpg|thumb|left|Pillory of Póvoa de Varzim.]] [[File:Vista para Povoa de Varzim sec XIX.jpg|thumb|left|240px|Downtown skyline in mid-19th century.]] [[File:Avenida Mouzinho Albuquerque Povoa Varzim.JPG|thumb|Mouzinho de Albuquerque avenue.]] Downtown is limited to the North by [[Bairro Norte]], to the south by [[Bairro Sul]], to the east by [[Barreiros, Póvoa de Varzim|Barreiros]]/[[Moninhas]] and [[Bairro da Matriz|Matriz]]/[[Mariadeira]] and to the west it borders [[Redonda Beach]] and Póvoa Cove.
Downtown Póvoa de Varzim is, to a large extent, made up of pedestrian areas, with difficult car access in much of its extension, although underground parking spaces are available in the waterfront and in Avenida Mouzinho de Albuquerque.
===Civic Center=== [[Praça do Almada]], the civic center, is landscaped in an egg-shape, cut in half by the National Highway 13, and is tipped by buildings with local style. The building of the City Hall (1791) dominates the square. In the square, the Manueline pillory of Póvoa de Varzim (1514) is a national monument and represents Póvoa de Varzim's self-government and laws. Next to the pillory, the romantic gazebo (1904) follows the liking of the old Povoan bourgeoisie for its spare time.<ref name="IPPAR">[http://www.igespar.pt/pt/patrimonio/pesquisa/geral/patrimonioimovel/detail/71021 Coreto da Praça do Almada] - IGESPAR</ref>
===Junqueira shopping district=== Despite being pedestrian, [[Rua da Junqueira]] is the most famous and elder of those three streets. Junqueira, which links Praça do Almada to the waterfront, appeared in the written records in 1694, even though artifacts from the Roman era surfaced in diverse street rearrangements and is the site of an ancient Roman fish factory. In 1839, the Town Hall expressed concerns over urbanization issues due to popularity of this street, one of the busiest in Póvoa de Varzim, as it became in that century a full-blown shopping street, identity that it maintained to these days in which ancient stores survive.
Undersized but charismatic squares in Junqueira district, between Praça do Almada and Passeio Alegre (waterfront) can be found: Praça da República and Largo David Alves.
===Old theater area=== From the surroundings of Praça do Almada, three parallel streets lead to the waterfront: Rua Tenente Valadim, that ends between the Casino and Grande Hotel, Rua da Junqueira and [[Rua Santos Minho]]. The later is related to the arts, most notably performing arts, since the 18th century. It was a square known as Campo das Cobras and the location of a theater since 1793, the local bullfighting arena and circus. The old building Salão Teatro (Theater Saloon) and [[Teatro Garrett]] Theater from the 19th century, with small artist's studios in the way, can still be found.
==History== {{main|History of Póvoa de Varzim}} Albeit inhabited since the Roman period, with Roman fish factories and a Roman villa. The seaport, a natural harbor, appeared in the written records in the 11th century, and the ship-making industry developed considerably in the 17th century, it was in the 18th century, with the fishing industry getting national importance, that defined the city center as it is today, with the Royal Provision by [[Maria I of Portugal|Queen Mary I]] on February 21, 1791. The queen ordered ''Corregedor'' Almada to reorganize the town's layout given Póvoa's prosperity and importance in the fishing sector. Prior to development the area had [[lagoons]] in the port area such as Boído Lagoon and Galé Lagoon.
The new civic center (''Praça Nova'' - New Square) with a new town hall was built in an area used as a market square during some periods in the site of Boído Lagoon. The square was later renamed [[Praça do Almada]] in honor of Corregedor Almada efforts. The new square replaced the old town hall around [[Praça Velha]], the Old civic center.
Prior to that, [[Junqueira (Póvoa de Varzim)|Junqueira]] district was already a bustling fishing quarter. As the 19th century moved in, and beach therapy became popular with the elites, [[Junqueira (Póvoa de Varzim)|Junqueira]] became a bourgeois shopping street.
In late 19th century and under the visions of David Alves, when Póvoa de Varzim was already a prosperous beach resort, sections of the urbanized area, which didn't grew in an orderly way, were demolished to give way for Mousinho de Albuquerque Avenue, linking [[Passeio Alegre]] Square to uptown's [[Largo das Dores|Dores Square]] (''Largo das Dores''), where mansions for the wealthy beach goers started being built. During late 20th century, some of the mansions and ''Orfeão Poveiro'' music hall ruins were destroyed to give rise to multifamily homes. Despite its losses, Mousinho Avenue got a new character, it became a central business avenue and a rehabilitation program was done in the 21st century.
Around Rego Square, later [[Largo David Alves|David Alves square]], appeared some of the most charismatic entertainment venues of Póvoa in the 19th century, the Hotel Luso-Brazileiro, the Chinês Saloon, Garrett Theater, and other entertainment venues. Centering the plaza, the Chinês Saloon appeared in 1882 and became popular all over the country and the most famous casino of Póvoa alongside Café David. The elites could listen to music, see shows with Spanish dancers, meet in [[tertulia]] and play roulette.
Old bourgeois area par excellence, with the increasing business importance of Junqueira and Praça do Almada, whose spaces had been taken for tertiary activities such as shops and offices, in such a way that, today, only few people live in the most central areas of the city.<ref name="deo">As Procissões na Póvoa de Varzim (1900–1950). Volume 1 - Deolinda Carneiro, Faculdade de Letras da Universidade do Porto. 2006</ref>
{{Póvoa de Varzim districts}}

{{Infobox company | name = Rescale, Inc. | logo = Rescale, Inc. logo.png | location = [[San Francisco, California]] | founded = 2011 | founder = [[Joris Poort]]
Adam McKenzie | homepage = {{URL|http://www.rescale.com|rescale.com}} | footnotes = }} Founded in 2011 in [[San Francisco]], California by [[Joris Poort]] (CEO) and Adam McKenzie (CTO), Rescale is a startup that develops a cloud computing simulation platform. Rescale was a [[Y Combinator (company)|Y Combinator]]{{cite web|title=Y Combinator|url=http://www.ycombinator.com|publisher=Y Combinator}} company and has received $6.4M in funding from high-profile investors including [[Sam Altman]], [[Jeff Bezos]],{{cite web|title=Bezos Expeditions|url=http://www.bezosexpeditions.com/}} [[Richard Branson]], [[Chris Dixon]],{{cite web|title=Angel List|url=https://angel.co/rescale}} Paul Graham, and [[Peter Thiel]].{{cite web|title=Rescale investors|url=http://www.rescale.com/investors/|publisher=Rescale}} {{cite news|url=https://blogs.wsj.com/venturecapital/2015/07/14/rescale-emerges-with-6-4m-to-make-complex-product-design-easier/|title=Rescale Emerges With $6.4M to Make Complex Product Design Easier |publisher=Wall Street Journal |date=2015-05-14 |accessdate=2015-05-14}} {{cite news|url=http://fortune.com/2015/07/14/rescale-nets-6-4m-to-build-a-better-engineering-cloud/|title=Superstar-backed Rescale nets $6.4 million to build a better engineering cloud|publisher=Fortune |date=2015-05-14 |accessdate=2015-05-14}} {{cite news|url=https://techcrunch.com/2015/07/14/rescale-scores-6-4m-from-a-whos-who-of-silicon-valley-investors/|title=Rescale Lands $6.4M From Who’s Who of Investors|publisher=TechCrunch |date=2015-05-14 |accessdate=2015-05-14}} The founders previously built a software technology stack at [[Boeing]] saving the company over $180M through weight improvements on the [[787 Dreamliner]].{{cite news|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/sanfrancisco/blog/2015/10/rescale-joris-poort-boeing-aerospace-simulation.html|title=Former Boeing engineer builds a better way to run simulations|publisher=San Francisco Business Times |date=2015-10-09 |accessdate=2015-10-18}} The Rescale platform combines engineering and science software tools with high performance computing (HPC) to create a cloud simulation environment. [http://www.deskeng.com/virtual_desktop/?p=6693 ''Design Engineering''] magazine describes Rescale as "...a good fit for manufacturers who need to run complex simulation and optimization jobs, but don't have the HPC hardware required." {{cite web|url=http://www.deskeng.com/virtual_desktop/?p=6693|title=Rescale: Build Your Own Simulation Template in the Cloud|author=Kenneth|work=Virtual Desktop}} [http://www.nextplatform.com/2015/05/27/rescales-political-stance-boosts-cloud-based-supercomputing/ ''The Platform''] noted in May, 2015 that Rescale claims the largest known globally available commercial HPC network with "...eight million servers globally with a potential 1,400 petaflops of compute capacity ... across 30 global datacenters." {{cite web|url=http://www.nextplatform.com/2015/05/27/rescales-political-stance-boosts-cloud-based-supercomputing/|title=Rescale’s Political Stance Boosts Cloud Based Supercomputing|work=The Platform}} Rescale has partnerships with engineering software companies in the [[computer aided engineering]] space including: [[ANSYS]], [[CD-adapco]],{{cite web|title=CD-Adapco Partners|url=http://cd-adapco.us/partner/rescale}} [[Dassault Systemes]],{{cite web|title=Simulia Technology Partners|url=http://www.3ds.com/products-services/simulia/alliances/technology-partners/rescale-inc/}} [[MSC Software]],{{cite web|title=MSC Technology Partners|url=http://www.mscsoftware.com/technology-partners}} and [[Siemens]].{{cite web|title=Siemens’ NX Nastran Now Available on Rescale On-Demand Cloud Environment|url=http://www.plm.automation.siemens.com/en_us/about_us/newsroom/press/press_release.cfm?Component=224493&ComponentTemplate=822}} ==See also== * [[Cloud computing]] * [[Enterprise software]] * [[High performance computing]] * [[Computer aided engineering]] * [[Product lifecycle management]] ==References== ==External links== * [http://www.rescale.com/ Rescale's website] [[Category:Business software]] {{company-stub}}

{{unreferenced|date=August 2014}} The '''statutory accounting principles''' are a set of accounting rules for insurance companies set forth by the [[National Association of Insurance Commissioners]]. They are used to prepare the statutory financial statements of insurance companies. With minor state-by-state variations, they are the basis for state regulation of [[Own risk and solvency assessment|insurance company solvency]] throughout the United States.
The rules are issued as discussion drafts, and public comments are solicited, before they are codified in the NAIC Accounting Practices and Procedures Manual.
==See also== * [[Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (United States)]] * [[Statutory reserve]]
== External links == * [http://www.naic.org/ NAIC Official Website] * [http://www.naic.org/committees_e_app_sapwg.htm Statutory Accounting Principles Working Group] * [http://www.actuary.org/financial.asp Risk Management and Financial Reporting Practice] of the [[American Academy of Actuaries]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2015}}{{animal testing}} '''Cosmetic testing on animals''' is a type of [[animal testing]] used to test the safety and [[hypoallergenic]] properties of products for use by humans. Due to the harm done to the animal subjects, this testing is opposed by [[animal rights ]] activists and others. Cosmetic animal testing is banned in the [[European Union]], [[India]], [[Israel]],<ref name="WorldPost"/><ref name="HSUS"/> and [[Norway]].<ref name="US Bill"/>
==Definition== Using animal testing in the development of [[cosmetics]] may involve testing either a finished product or the individual ingredients of a finished product on animals, often [[rabbit]]s, as well as [[mice]], [[rat]]s, and other animals. Cosmetics can be defined as products applied to the body in various ways in order to enhance the body's appearance or to cleanse the body. This includes all hair products, makeup, nail products and soaps.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fda.gov/Cosmetics/GuidanceRegulation/LawsRegulations/ucm074201.htm|title=Laws & Regulations - Is It a Cosmetic, a Drug, or Both? (Or Is It Soap?)|first=Center for Food Safety and Applied|last=Nutrition|date=|website=www.fda.gov|accessdate=2 April 2018}}</ref>
The United States [[Food and Drug Administration]] (FDA) continues to endorse animal testing methods.<ref name="aavs.org"/>
Re-using existing test data obtained from previous animal testing is generally not considered to be cosmetic testing on animals; however, the acceptability of this to opponents of testing is inversely proportional to how recent the data is.<ref>{{cite web|title=Kunde oder Vertriebspartner werden|url=http://www.vegas-germany.de/|website=VEGAS Cosmetics|language=de-DE|date=16 June 2015}}</ref>
==Methods== Methods of testing cosmetics on animals include many different tests that are categorized differently based on which areas the cosmetics will be used for. One new ingredient in any cosmetic product used in these tests could lead to the deaths of at least 1,400 animals <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nst.com.my/lifestyle/flair/2017/09/276688/cruelty-free-cosmetics |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2018-02-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180209063147/https://www.nst.com.my/lifestyle/flair/2017/09/276688/cruelty-free-cosmetics |archivedate=9 February 2018 |df=dmy-all }}. </ref>
Dermal penetration: Rats are mostly used in this method that analyzes moment of a chemical, and the penetration of the chemical in the bloodstream. Dermal penetration is a method that creates a better understanding of skin absorption.<ref name="aavs.org"/>
Skin sensitisation: This is a method that determines if a chemical causes an allergic reaction. The chemical adjuvant is injected to boost the immune system. In the past it was performed on guinea pigs, and applied on a shaved patch of skin. Substances are assessed based on appearance of skin.<ref name="aavs.org"/>
Acute toxicity: This test is used to determine danger of exposure to a chemical by mouth, skin, or inflammation. Rats and mice are injected in lethal dose 50% (LD50). This test can cause animal convulsions, loss of motor function, and seizures.<ref name="aavs.org">{{cite web|url=http://aavs.org/animals-science/how-animals-are-used/testing/|title=Testing|work=American Anti-Vivisection Society}}</ref>
[[Draize test]]: This is a method of testing that may cause irritation or corrosion to the skin or eye on animals, dermal sensitization, airway sensitization, endocrine disruption, and {{LD50}} (which refers to the lethal dose which kills 50% of the treated animals).
Skin corrosivity or irritation: This method of test assesses the potential of a substance causing irreversible damage to the skin. It is typically performed on rabbits and involves putting chemicals on a shaved patch of skin. This determines the level of damage to the skin that includes itching, inflammation, swelling, etc.<ref name="aavs.org"/>
==Alternatives== Cosmetics manufacturers who do not test on animals may now use ''in vitro'' screens to test for endpoints which can determine potential risk to humans with a very high sensitivity and specificity. Companies such as CeeTox in the USA, recently acquired by Cyprotex, specialize in such testing and organizations like the Center for Alternatives to Animal Testing (CAAT), PETA and many other organizations advocate the use of ''in vitro'' and other non-animal tests in the development of consumer products. By using safe ingredients from a list of 5,000 which have already been tested in conjunction with modern methods of cosmetics testing, the need for tests using animals are negated.<ref name="Aus"/>
EpiSkin™, EpiDerm™ and SkinEthic are each composed of artificial human skin as an option for alternative testing. Artificial skin can imitate the reaction actual human skin will have to a product and the chemicals it contains and can be altered to mimic different skin types and ages. For example, using UV light on EpiSkin can cause it to resemble older skin and adding melanocytes will turn the skin a darker color. This helped create a spectrum of different skin colors that are then used to compare the results of sunblock on a different variety of people.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Merali|first=Zeeya|date=July 28, 2007|title=New Scientist|url=|journal=Human skin to replace animal tests|volume=195|pages=14-14|via=|doi=10.1016/s0262-4079(07)61866-1}}</ref> To address potential issues with other parts of the human body, research companies such as NOTOX have developed a synthetic model of the human liver, which is the main organ to detox the body, in order to test harmful ingredients and chemicals to see if the liver can detox those elements.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Mone|first=Gregory|date=April 2014|title=New Models in Cosmetics Replacing Animal Testing|url=|journal=Communications of the ACM|volume=57|pages=20–21|doi=10.1145/2581925}}</ref> Research companies can also use body parts and organs taken from animals slaughtered for the [[meat industry]] to perform tests such as the Bovine Corneal Opacity and Permeability Test and Isolated Chicken Eye Test.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Alternatives to Animal Tests : The Humane Society of the United States|url = http://m.humanesociety.org/issues/cosmetic_testing/facts/alternatives_animal_tests.html?credit=web_id329654370|website = m.humanesociety.org|access-date = 2016-02-12}}</ref>
==History== In 1937, a mistake was made that ended up changing the pharmaceutical industry drastically. A company created a medicine “to treat streptococcal infections”, and without any scientific research the medicine was out on shelves.<ref name="medicaldaily.com">Scutti, Susan. "Animal Testing: A Long, Unpretty History." Medical Daily, 27 June 2013,www.medicaldaily.com/animal-testing-long-unpretty-history-247217.</ref> This medicine turned out to be extremely poisonous to people, leading to large poisoning outbreaks followed by over 100 deaths.<ref name="medicaldaily.com"/> This epidemic led to a law being passed in 1938, called the U.S. Food, Drug, and Cosmetics Act, enforcing more rigorous guidelines on cosmetic products.<ref>Scutti,Susan. "Animal Testing: A Long, Unpretty History." Medical Daily, 27 June 2013,www.medicaldaily.com/animal-testing-long-unpretty-history-247217.</ref> After this law was passed companies looked to animals to test their products, in turn, creating the first encounters of cosmetic animal testing.
== Non-profit organizations == [[Image:NoAnimalTesting.png|right|thumb|This "Leaping Bunny" indicates that cosmetic products with this logo have not been tested on animals.]] *'''Cruelty Free International: '''Cruelty Free International and its partners manage the certification of all the companies across the world looking to be cruelty free. Companies producing beauty and household products which do not test their products on animals for any market can request membership of ''The Leaping Bunny Program'', which allows that company to feature [[Cruelty Free International]]'s Leaping Bunny logo on their products. This program sets global standard of operations and sales. Companies headquartered internationally can obtain certification from Cruelty Free International.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.crueltyfreeinternational.org/what-we-do/corporate-partnerships/corporate-faqs|title=Frequently asked questions by companies - Cruelty Free International|publisher=}}</ref> Companies headquartered in the United States and Canada can obtain certification from The Coalition for Consumer Information on Cosmetics (CCIC)<ref>[http://www.crueltyfreeinternational.org/en/around-the-world/usa About Cruelty Free International] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131216190348/http://www.crueltyfreeinternational.org/en/around-the-world/usa |date=16 December 2013 }}. Cruelty Free International, d.d.</ref> In 2013, over 500 companies were certified.<ref>[http://www.leapingbunny.org/press12.php Leaping Bunny Welcomes Wen® Hair and Body Care by Chaz Dean as Cruelty-Free]. Leapingbunny.org, d.d.</ref> However, some company's certifications were revoked after it was discovered they continued to test on animals in Asia.<ref>[http://www.eluxemagazine.com/magazine/cruelty-in-china/]. Eluxe Magazine, d.d.</ref> *'''Humane Society International:''' This is a global animal protection organization that works to help all animals—including animals in laboratories.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hsi.org/about/|title=About Us : Humane Society International|author=|date=|website=www.hsi.org|accessdate=2 April 2018}}</ref>
==Procedures of animal testing== {{See also|The Three Rs (animals)}} There is a strategy used in animal testing laboratories titled the 'Three R's:' Reduction, refinement, and replacement' (Doke, "Alternatives to Animal Testing: A Review"). *'''Reduction:''' This approach is built upon the ethics to have a minimal number of animal subjects being tested on for current and later tests. *'''Refinement:''' This suggests that the planned distress and pain caused to an animal subject to be as little as possible. This approach focuses on making a home for the animals before entering testing grounds in order to elongate the life of laboratory animals. Discomfort to animals causes an imbalance in hormonal levels which create fluctuating results during testing. *'''Replacement:''' This provides the opportunity to study the response of cellular models, but in other words, replacement searches for alternatives that could be done rather than testing on animal subjects.{{citation needed|date=December 2015}}
==Legal requirements and status== {{update section|date=December 2015}} Due to the strong public backlash against cosmetic testing on animals, most cosmetic manufacturers say their products are not tested on animals. However, they are still required by trading standards and [[consumer protection]] laws in most countries to show their products are not toxic and not dangerous to public health, and that the ingredients are not dangerous in large quantities, such as when in transport or in the manufacturing plant. In some countries, it is possible to meet these requirements without any further tests on animals. In other countries, it may require animal testing to meet legal requirements. The United States and Japan are frequently criticized for their insistence on stringent safety measures, which often requires animal testing. Some retailers distinguish themselves in the marketplace by their stance on animal testing.
=== Legal requirements in Japan ===
Although Japanese law doesn’t require non-medicated cosmetics to be tested on animals, it doesn’t prohibit it either, leaving the decision to individual companies.<ref name="hsi.org">{{cite web|title=Be Cruelty-Free Campaign Backed by Global Stars, Launches in Tokyo to End Cosmetics Animal Testing in Japan (March 17, 2014)|url=http://www.hsi.org/news/press_releases/2014/03/japan-bcf-campaign-launch-031714.html|website=Humane Society International|accessdate=12 May 2015}}</ref> Animal testing is required mainly when the product contains newly-developed tar colors, ultraviolet ray protective ingredients or preservatives, and when the amount of any ingredient regulated in terms of how much can be added is increased.<ref>{{cite web|title=Development of Cosmetics -- Toward Abolishment of Animal Testing (February 2015)|url=http://www.japanfs.org/en/news/archives/news_id035188.html|website=JFS: Japan for Sustainability|accessdate=12 May 2015}}</ref>
Japanese Brands such as Shiseido and Mandom have ended much, but not all, of their animal testing. However, most other leading cosmetics companies in Japan still test on animals.<ref name="hsi.org"/><ref>{{cite web|title=Initiatives in Response to Animal Testing and Alternative Methods|url=https://www.shiseidogroup.com/csr/challenge/experiment/|website=Shiseido Group|accessdate=12 May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Approach to alternative to animal experiments|url=http://www.mandom.co.jp/english/eco/src/society_animal.html|website=Mandom|accessdate=12 May 2015}}</ref>
=== Jurisdictions with bans ===
==== Brazil, São Paulo ==== [[São Paulo]] in Brazil, banned cosmetic animal testing in 2014.<ref name="Sao Paulo">{{cite news|title=São Paulo Bans Animal Testing|url=http://www.petmd.com/news/care-safety/sao-paulo-bans-animal-testing-31269|publisher=AFP News|date=24 January 2014}}</ref>
==== European Union ==== The European Union (EU) followed suit, after it agreed to phase in a near-total ban on the sale of animal-tested cosmetics throughout the EU from 2009, and to ban cosmetics-related animal testing.<ref name="Euro">{{cite news|title=EU extends ban on animal-tested cosmetics|url=http://www.euronews.com/2013/03/11/eu-extends-ban-on-animal-tested-cosmetics/|date=11 March 2013|publisher=EuroNews}}</ref> Animal testing is regulated in [[EC Regulation 1223/2009 on cosmetics#Restrictions for hazardous ingredients and animal testing|EC Regulation 1223/2009 on cosmetics]]. Imported cosmetics ingredients tested on animals were phased out for EU consumer markets in 2013 by the ban,<ref name="Euro"/> but can still be sold to outside of the EU.<ref name="Rhiannon"/> Norway banned cosmetics animal testing the same time as the EU.<ref>{{cite news|title=Norway ban animal testing of cosmetics|url=http://www.theoslotimes.com/norway-ban-animal-testing-of-cosmetics/|work=The Oslo Times|date=12 March 2013|author=Aryan|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140318075255/http://www.theoslotimes.com/norway-ban-animal-testing-of-cosmetics/|archivedate=18 March 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref> In May 2018 the European Parliament voted for the EU and its Member States to work towards a UN convention against the use of animal testing for cosmetics.<ref>{{cite news|title=Foster: "Cosmetic testing on animals must be banned worldwide”|url=http://conservativeeurope.com/news/foster-cosmetic-testing-on-animals-must-be-banned-worldwide|work=Conservatives in the European Parliament|date=3 May 2018|author=Jacqueline Foster}}</ref>
==== India ==== In early 2014, India announced a ban on testing cosmetics on animals in the country, thereby becoming the second country in Asia to do so.<ref name="India">{{cite news|title=Govt bans cosmetic companies from testing on animals|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/Govt-bans-cosmetic-companies-from-testing-on-animals/articleshow/29225017.cms|date=23 Jan 2014|author=Mukherjee, Rupali|work=The Times of India}}</ref> Later India banned import of cosmetics tested on animals in November 2014.<ref name="Mohan 2014">{{cite web | last=Mohan | first=Vishwa | title=India bans import of cosmetics tested on animals |work=The Times of India | date=14 October 2014 | url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/India-bans-import-of-cosmetics-tested-on-animals/articleshow/44814398.cms | accessdate=1 December 2015}}</ref>
==== Israel ==== Israel banned "the import and marketing of cosmetics, toiletries or detergents that were tested on animals" in 2013.<ref name="Israel">{{cite news|title=Import ban on animal-tested products goes into effect|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/import-ban-on-animal-tested-products-goes-into-effect/|work=The Times of Israel|date=1 January 2013}}</ref>
==== New Zealand ==== In 2015, New Zealand also banned animal testing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radionz.co.nz/news/political/270097/mps-unanimously-support-animal-testing-ban|title=MPs unanimously support animal testing ban|date=31 March 2015|work=Radio New Zealand}}</ref>
==== Turkey ==== Turkey "banned any animal testing for cosmetic products that have already been introduced to the market." <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailysabah.com/nation/2015/07/27/animal-testing-for-cosmetics-banned-in-turkey|title=Animal testing for cosmetics banned in Turkey|date=27 July 2015|work=DailySabah}}</ref>
==== UK ==== Animal testing on cosmetics or their ingredients was banned in the UK in 1998.<ref>{{cite web|title=Animal Research Regulations in the UK |url=http://speakingofresearch.com/facts/animal-research-regulations-in-the-uk/ |accessdate=10 September 2015}}</ref>
=== Jurisdictions where prohibitions are considered ===
==== Association of Southeast Asian Nations ==== The [[Association of Southeast Asian Nations]] (ASEAN) is potentially "making strides toward ending cosmetics testing on animals."<ref name="US Bill"/>
==== Australia ==== In Australia, the ''End Cruel Cosmetics Bill'' was introduced to Parliament in March 2014, which would ban local testing, which generally doesn't happen there, and importation of cosmetics tested on animals.<ref name="Aus"/> In 2016 a bill was passed to ban the sale of cosmetics tested on animals, which will come into effect in July 2017.<ref>http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/cosmetics-tested-on-animals-to-be-banned-in-australia/news-story/a6362ab50a6146af5c83e60c8e40d93e</ref>
==== Brazil ==== Brazil's legislation will vote on a nationwide animal testing for cosmetics ban by the end of March 2014.<ref name="HSUS"/>
==== United States ==== In March 2014, the ''Humane Cosmetics Act'' was introduced to the U.S. congress which would ban cosmetic testing on animals and eventually would ban the sale of cosmetics tested on animals.<ref name="US Bill"/> The bill did not advance.
==== South Korea ==== South Korea is also potentially "making strides toward ending cosmetics testing on animals."<ref name="US Bill"/>
==== Taiwan ==== In 2015, Taiwan launched a bill proposing a ban on cosmetic testing on animals.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cosmeticsandtoiletries.com/testing/animalalt/Taiwan-Proposes-Animal-Testing-Ban-for-Cosmetics-303286171.html|title=Taiwan Proposes Animal Testing Ban for Cosmetics|publisher=}}</ref> It passed in 2016 and goes into effect in 2019.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hsi.org/news/press_releases/2016/10/taiwan-bans-cosmetics-animal-testing-072116.html|title=Taiwan bans cosmetics animal testing|publisher=Humane Society International}}</ref>
=== Other statuses ===
==== China ==== China passed a law on 30 June 2014 to eliminate the requirement for animal testing of cosmetics. Though domestically-produced ordinary cosmetic goods do not require testing, animal testing is still mandated by law for Chinese-made "cosmeceuticals" (cosmetic goods which make a functional claim) which are available for sale in China. Cosmetics intended solely for export are exempt from the animal testing requirement.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ethicalelephant.com/understanding-china-animal-testing-laws/|title=Understanding China's Animal Testing Laws 2015|author=|date=9 September 2015|website=ethicalelephant.com|accessdate=2 April 2018}}</ref>
==== Russia ==== In 2013, the Russian Ministry of Health stated "Toxicological testing is performed by means of testing for skin allergic reaction or test on [[mucous tissue]]/eye area (with use of lab animals) or by use of alternative general toxicology methods (IN VITRO). In this manner the technical regulations include measures which provide an alternative to animal testing".<ref name="Russia">{{cite web|title=Cruelty Free International wins Russian commitment on non-animal testing|url=http://www.crueltyfreeinternational.org/en/a/Cruelty-Free-International-wins-Russian-commitment-on-non-animal-testing|accessdate=12 May 2015|archivedate=18 May 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150518073423/http://www.crueltyfreeinternational.org/en/a/Cruelty-Free-International-wins-Russian-commitment-on-non-animal-testing|df=dmy-all}}</ref> <!--===UK position=== Although the British Home Office stopped giving licences to test finished cosmetic products in 1998, compounds that have both cosmetic and medical uses, such as those in the "anti-wrinkle" preparations Zyderm, Restylane and [[Botox]], are still bound by the regulations requiring animal testing. According to activists, a raid on a laboratory in 2004 revealed that the {{LD50}} test is still used on every batch of Botox (a [[toxin]] that, when administered intravenously, is lethal to humans) to establish potency.<ref>{{cite news |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120918114852/http://menmedia.co.uk/manchestereveningnews/news/s/156/156795_animal_rights_man_faces_jail_over_lab_raid.html |url=http://menmedia.co.uk/manchestereveningnews/news/s/156/156795_animal_rights_man_faces_jail_over_lab_raid.html |archivedate=18 September 2012 |title=Animal rights man faces jail over lab raid |date=29 April 2005 |work=[[Manchester Evening News]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060217084038/http://www.animalaid.org.uk/news/2004/0401boto.htm |url=http://www.animalaid.org.uk/news/2004/0401boto.htm |archivedate=17 February 2006 |publisher=Animal Aid |title=Boycott Botox! – Cosmetic scandal exposed |date=January 2004 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070929132044/http://www.sarconline.co.uk/modules.php?op=modload&name=News&file=article&sid=129&mode=thread&order=0&thold=0&POSTNUKESID=f070fc85519cfcb46ad4f3d2d92abb1c |url=http://www.sarconline.co.uk/modules.php?op=modload&name=News&file=article&sid=129&mode=thread&order=0&thold=0&POSTNUKESID=f070fc85519cfcb46ad4f3d2d92abb1c |archivedate=29 September 2007 |title=Keith Mann Sentanced <nowiki>[sic]</nowiki> – Press response |publisher=Southern Animal Rights Coalition }}</ref>-->

1,000 watts nighttime |erp = |haat = |class = B |facility_id = 3013 |coordinates = {{coord|42|26|54.00|N|71|25|39.00|W|region:US-MA_type:landmark|name=WBNW|display=inline,title}} |callsign_meaning = '''B'''usiness '''N'''e'''W'''s |former_callsigns = WADN (1989–1998) |former_frequencies = |affiliations = [[Westwood One]] |owner = Money Matters Radio, Inc. |licensee = |sister_stations = |webcast = {{TuneIn|Money-Matters-Boston-1120-s27548}} |website = {{URL|http://www.moneymattersboston.com/}} }} '''WBNW''' (1120 [[AM broadcasting|AM]]) is a business [[talk radio]] [[radio station|station]] in the [[Boston, Massachusetts|Boston]] market. The station is owned by Money Matters Radio, Inc. and is licensed to [[Concord, Massachusetts]]. It is simulcast on [[Broadcast translator|translator station]] W275CM (102.9 [[FM broadcasting|FM]]) in Concord. WBNW's flagship program, ''The Financial Exchange'', is syndicated to several other stations in [[New England]] through the '''Money Matters Radio Network'''. Recently talk hosts [[Michael Graham (radio personality)|Michael Graham]], [[Don Imus]], and [[John Batchelor]] were added to the lineup. ==History== The station first took to the air August 28, 1989 as '''WADN''', with a [[folk music]] format.{{cite news|last=Bickelhaupt|first=Susan|title=WADN-AM to feature folk music|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P2-8133535.html|accessdate=January 27, 2012|newspaper=[[The Boston Globe]]|date=August 15, 1989}} (subscription content preview) Much of the station's staff had previously worked at an earlier Boston-area folk music station, WCAS (740 AM, now [[WJIB]]).{{cite news|last=Fybush|first=Scott|title=So Long to Folk on WADN|url=http://www.bostonradio.org/nerw/nerw-961230.html|accessdate=January 27, 2012|newspaper=New England RadioWatch|date=December 30, 1996}} Original owner Walden Communications Company sold the station to Assabet Communications Corporation on June 4, 1993.{{cite web|title=Application Search Details|url=http://licensing.fcc.gov/cgi-bin/ws.exe/prod/cdbs/pubacc/prod/app_det.pl?Application_id=179766|work=CDBS Public Access|publisher=[[Federal Communications Commission]]|accessdate=January 27, 2012}} Shortly after the original WBNW (590 AM) was acquired by [[Salem Communications]] and became [[Religious broadcasting|religious]] station [[WEZE]] in December 1996, WADN announced that it would begin carrying some [[Bloomberg Radio]] programming;{{cite news|last=Fybush|first=Scott|title=WEZE Moves to 590|url=http://www.bostonradio.org/nerw/nerw-961212.html|accessdate=January 27, 2012|newspaper=New England RadioWatch|date=December 12, 1996}} by the end of the month, the folk format was moved to weekends only to accommodate the business and talk programming, and in April 1997 folk was dropped entirely. Money Matters Radio bought WADN in 1998;{{cite news|last=Fybush|first=Scott|title=1150 Splits Off...|url=http://www.bostonradio.org/nerw/nerw-980514.html|accessdate=January 27, 2012|newspaper=North East RadioWatch|date=May 14, 1998}} it had produced the station's morning show, also simulcast on [[WPLM (AM)|WPLM]] (1390 AM) in [[Plymouth, Massachusetts|Plymouth]], WNRB (1510 AM, now [[WMEX (AM)|WMEX]]) in Boston, and [[Attleboro, Massachusetts|Attleboro]]-based [[WARA (AM)|WARA]] (1320 AM), since 1997.{{cite news|last=Fybush|first=Scott|title=Sales and Format Changes Everywhere...|url=http://www.bostonradio.org/nerw/nerw-971023.html|accessdate=January 27, 2012|newspaper=North East RadioWatch|date=October 23, 1997}} The call letters were changed to WBNW on December 1, 1998.{{cite news|last=Fybush|first=Scott|title=Big Apple's Big Changes, and, We Visit The Midwest|url=http://www.bostonradio.org/nerw/nerw-981211.html|accessdate=January 27, 2012|newspaper=North {{BLP sources|date=April 2009}} '''Wan Kuok-koi''' ({{zh|t=尹國駒|w=Wan Gwok-keui|p=Yǐn Guójū}}; born 1955), popularly known as '''Broken Tooth Koi''' (崩牙駒; Cantonese: bung nga keui; Mandarin: bēng yá jū),<ref>http://www.lasvegassun.com/news/2012/nov/30/notorious-macau-gangster-broken-tooth-koi-set-pris/ Notorious gangster 'Broken Tooth' freed from prison in Macau, SCMP, 2 Dec 2012, John Carney</ref> was, until his arrest, the leader of the [[Macau]] branch of the [[14K Triad]]. He was released after more than 14 years in prison on 1 December 2012.<ref>https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5h4-kVr36GfWQf-SiQJc3_YbkY2cQ?docId=CNG.e005752de618c89324b5cd4777c3b725.441</ref>
== Gang war with former associate ==
However, tension between the two gangsters grew as Wai grew wary of Wan's high-profile persona. Teaming up with rival triad group the [[Shui Fong]], a vicious turf war broke out in 1996 and 1997. In early 1997, an unsigned letter was sent to several newspapers in the area. It said: ''"Warning: From this day on it is forbidden to mention Broken Tooth Koi in the press; otherwise bullets will have no eyes, and knives and bullets will have no feelings."''
In 1997 Wan briefly fled Macau to avoid two arrest warrants, one from a new anti-triad law enacted in Macau, and one for drug-trafficking from [[China]]. However, in August a Portuguese judge cleared Wan of all charges, and unexpectedly retired and moved back to Portugal the very next day.
Wan then proceeded to attack Wai in public, putting up posters claiming he was a drug trafficker and declaring that anyone visiting Wai's casinos would become his enemy. Ultimately, Wan amassed enough power and influence and took over Wai's rackets completely. By this time he was earning $6 million a month from his legal gambling establishments.
== Involvement in the film industry and arrest ==
In the autumn of 1997, Wan approached Hong Kong movie producer [[Henry Fong Ping]] to produce a film based on his life. The result was the 1998 movie ''Casino'' (aka ''Ho Kong Fung Wan'') starring [[Simon Yam]] as Giant, a triad boss living the high life in the Macau underworld. Wan agreed to extensive research meetings to make the film as accurate as possible, as well as using his influence on Macau to help the crew film.
One of his most outrageous stunts was to close down the [[Governador Nobre de Carvalho Bridge|Macau-Taipa Bridge]] for some hours to allow filming of a crucial scene in the movie. The producers had asked the Macau Government for permission to film on the bridge, closing it to traffic, but permission was denied. However, Wan wanted the scene to be shot anyway so he closed traffic from both sides of the bridge without any warning and the scene was filmed in this manner. Traffic to and from Macau was, because of this, halted for around two hours. No [[Public Security Police Force of Macau|police]] intervention was made or any other measures by the [[Government of Macau|Macau Government]] were taken to reopen the bridge to normal traffic flow on what was then one of the two links between Macau mainland and [[Taipa]]-[[Coloane]].
A week before opening night, as he watched his own movie ''Casino'', Wan was arrested and charged with illegal gambling, loan-sharking, criminal association, and attempted murder of chief of police Antonio Marques Baptista with a car bomb. In November 1999, in a landmark trial, he was convicted and jailed, along with eight associates including his brother Wan Kuok-hung. Wan was sentenced to 15 years in prison. All assets of the nine were confiscated.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/asia-pacific/533226.stm 'Broken Tooth' goes to jail], BBC News, 23 November 1999</ref> His jail term was later reduced to 13 years and 10 months.<ref name=MDTdec12/>
Wan was released from prison on 1 December 2012 and is thought to be planning to re-enter the casino junkets business.<ref name=MDTdec12>[http://www.macaudailytimes.com.mo/macau/38602-%E2%80%98broken-tooth%E2%80%99-koi-to-be-released-december-1st%3A-pj-setting-up-taskforce-to-%E2%80%98welcome%E2%80%99-wan.html http://www.macaudailytimes.com.mo/broken-tooth-koi-to-be-released-december-1st], Macau Daily Times, 14 Sep 2012</ref><ref>[http://www.thestandard.com.hk/news_detail.asp?we_cat=12&art_id=126877&sid=37773603&con_type=3&d_str=20120928&fc=7 Crime Lord Returns - The Standard 28 Sep 2012]</ref>
== Private and public life ==
Much like [[Nicky Barnes]] and [[John Gotti]], Wan kept a very stylish public appearance, driving expensive sports cars and wearing expensive suits and jewelery. Prior to his prison sentence he went through three marriages and has fathered six children.
As a result of his gangster lifestyle he has also acquired a number of wounds. He has been shot twice and has had his arms badly mangled by [[meat cleavers]], and as a result cannot straighten his two middle fingers.
